# APRA Music Awards of 1986

| location       =
| website        =
| network        =
| runtime        =
| ratings        =
| previous       = 1985
| main           = APRA Music Award
| next           = 1987
}}
The Australasian Performing Right Association Awards of 1986 (generally known as APRA Awards) are a series of awards held in 1986. The APRA Music Awards were presented by Australasian Performing Right Association (APRA) and the Australasian Mechanical Copyright Owners Society (AMCOS).
Awards
Only winners are noted
{| class="wikitable"
|-
! Award
! Winner
|-
| Gold Award
| "And the Band Played Waltzing Matilda" (Eric Bogle) by Eric Bogle, the Bushwackers
|-
| Most Performed Australasian Music for Film
| Razorback (Iva Davies) by Iva Davies
|-
| Most Performed Australasian Country Work
| "I'm Married to My Bulldog Mack" (Graeme Connors, Doug Trevor) by Graeme Connors
|-
| Most Performed Australasian Popular Work
| "Soul Kind of Feeling" (Robert Susz) by Dynamic Hepnotics
|-
| Most Performed Australasian Serious Work
| Trio for Flute, Clarinet & Bassoon (George Dreyfus)
|-
| Most Performed Australasian Jazz Work
| "For All Colours" (Vince Jones) by Vince Jones
|-
| Most Performed Overseas Work
| "I Just Called to Say I Love You" (Stevie Wonder) by Stevie Wonder
|-
|}

* Music of Australia
